OTHER PARTIES

Table of Contents

 

In Queensland  

 

In Queensland, a WHS entry permit holder must give at least 24 hours' (but not more than 14 days') notice of their proposed entry to both the PCBU and the person in management or control of the workplace. Failure to give notice can result in penalties of up to $22,700.

 

BE CAREFUL

 

A WHS entry permit holder cannot be refused entry to a workplace or be hindered in exercising his or her rights without a reasonable excuse.

A union may apply for a WHS entry permit for a union official who has completed the necessary training. The regulator or a delegated authority may issue a permit at its discretion. (In Victoria, the equivalent of a WHS entry permit holder is an authorised representative of a registered organisation.)

 

Click the button below for more information

 

Victoria: authorised representative of registered organisation

 

Except in Queensland, a WHS entry permit holder can enter a workplace without notice if they are investigating a suspected WHS breach that relates to workers who are members of that union (or are eligible to be).

 

As soon as it is reasonably practicable after entering the workplace, the permit holder must advise the relevant PCBU (and the person with management or control of the workplace) of their entry, and the nature of the suspected contravention.

In Queensland
